intro: Weberbauera stenophylla, commonly known as the narrow-leaf weberbaueria, is a species of flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Violaceae, which includes violets and related genera. The plant is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are typically blue or violet in color, with five petals arranged in a symmetrical pattern. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in tropical and subtropical regions.
